text: Jožef Smej, (born February 15, 1922) is a Slovene Prelate of Roman Catholic Church. Tzernicus at Catholic-Hierarchy. Titular Episcopal See of Tzernicus at GCatholic.org. Smej was born in Bogojina, Slovenia and was ordained a priest on December 8, 1944. Smej was appointed auxiliary archbishop of the Archdiocese of Maribor, as well as titular archbishop of Tzernicus, on April 15, 1983 and ordained bishop on May 23, 1983. Smej held the position of auxiliary bishop of the Maribor diocese until his retirement on June 18, 2009. ==See also== *List of oldest Catholic bishops *Archdiocese of Maribor ==References== ==External links== *Catholic-Hierarchy *Maribor Archdiocese Category:1922 births Category:Living people Category:People from the Municipality of Moravske Toplice Category:Slovenian Roman Catholic bishops Category:Roman Catholic titular bishops Category:20th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:21st-century Roman Catholic bishops
title: Jožef Smej
